'''Peter Vaughan''' (born 4 April 1923) is a British actor. He has appeared many times on screen and on stage since the 1950s, including a leading role alongside Frank Sinatra in ''The Naked Runner''. He appeared in many British television series of the 1960s and 1970s, including ''[[wikipedia:Porridge (TV series)|Porridge]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Randall and Hopkirk (Deceased)|Randall and Hopkirk (Deceased)]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Citizen Smith|Citizen Smith]]''. He also played the role of [[wikipedia:Denethor|Denethor]] in the acclaimed 1981 BBC radio dramatisation of ''[[wikipedia:The Lord of the Rings|The Lord of the Rings]]''. More recent roles including a recurring stint on ''[[wikipedia:Lark Rise to Candleford (TV series)|Lark Rise to Candleford]]''.

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' Vaughan is playing [[Maester Aemon]]. He was confirmed in the role on 16 July 2010.

Vaughan is partially blind and portrays the blind character, Aemon, in the show.
